Lateral entry opportunities for mid-stream enrollment

facilities.classrooms_labs_quality: Small, atmospheric school buildings in the middle of Amsterdam South
facilities.additional_locations: Dependance at Jan van Eijckstraat 21, 1077 LG Amsterdam

diversity.note: Welcomes diverse students: From adventurer to study enthusiast and from quiet achiever to wise guy

environment.culture_values: A pleasant and committed school where students can explore where their talents, weaknesses and possibilities lie. Values diversity and helps students grow both personally and in academic ambitions.

awards: Rosa Training School for educator development

strengths: Small, atmospheric buildings providing intimate learning environment
Located in desirable Amsterdam Zuid area
Part of Cedergroep school network providing resources and support
Rosa Training School designation showing commitment to teaching excellence
Strong focus on personal growth alongside academic development
Welcomes diverse student personalities and learning styles
Active community engagement through social media and events

considerations: Protestant affiliation may be factor for some families

best_fit_for: Students seeking small, personal learning environment
Students who need to explore and discover their talents
Students wanting community-focused, intimate school culture
Students with diverse personalities from quiet achievers to enthusiastic learners
ai_analysis.summary: HLZ (Hervormd Lyceum Zuid) is a pleasant and committed Protestant school in Amsterdam Zuid offering HAVO and VWO education in small, atmospheric buildings. Part of the Cedergroep network and designated as a Rosa Training School, HLZ provides an intimate learning environment where students can explore their talents, weaknesses, and possibilities. The school welcomes diverse student personalities and emphasizes both personal and academic growth in a supportive community setting.
